title: Queen Letizia of Spain cut a stylish figure as she arrives at an awards ceremony in Madrid
text:
Queen Letizia of Spain cut a stylish figure as she arrived at IESE Business School in Madrid, Spain, today.

The royal, 47, who was presenting the 'International Friendship Award, looked like she meant business in a chic black blouse featuring plunging neckline and a checked grey skirt.

The mother-of-two accessorised with a belt that cinched her in at the waist and completed her outfit with a pair of skyscraper black stilettos.

She wore her glossy brown locks down and appeared poised on stage as she held her hands in front of her waist.

Queen Letizia of Spain, 47, looked like she meant business in a silk black blouse and grey checked skirt - complete with a flattering waist-belt

The royal looked poised as she took to the stage at the 'International Friendship Award' at IESE Business School in Madrid, Spain

The occasion marked the third edition of the International Friendship Award (IFA) in IESE Business School.

The award recognises prominent business leaders for their contribution to economic and social progress in their countries - including those from China, Nigeria and South Africa.

It's been a busy few months for Queen Letizia, who cut a sophisticated figure as she joined her husband King Felipe for a gala in Seoul on 23 October.

The Spanish royal once again turned heads in a pastel floral dress with a sheer panel at the neckline while attending the dinner, which was hosted by South Korean President Moon Jae-in and wife Kim Jung-sook.

The Spanish royal was all smiles as she carried her smart black bag before heading inside to the Business school in Madrid

The mother-of-two received a warm welcome and opted to wear her glossy brown locks down for the occasion

Putting her best step forward, the Queen of Spain has made several stylish appearances in recent weeks

Margarita Robles, Queen Letizia of Spain and Pedro Nueno took to the stage at the prestigious awards ceremony

The prestigious ceremony marked the third edition of the International Friendship Award. Pictured, one of the deserving recipients on stage

Letizia and Felipe undertook a two-day visit to the country to discuss economy and trade.

It followed their visit to Tokyo earlier that week to attend the enthronement ceremony for the Japanese emperor, who ascended the throne on 1 May.

And at the beginning of the month. Queen Letizia attended official events to mark National Day in Spain, with the royal choosing a romantic blush pink dress for the occasion.

She was photographed enjoying a military parade in Madrid alongside her husband and their two daughters princesses Leonor and Sofia.

She wore an elegant pink lace collar dress by Felipe Varela with sheer sleeves and delicate embroidery while her husband looked smart in a military suit.

She teamed the chic number with a pair of Steve Madden blush pink court shoes, a hot pink clutch from Magrit and statement pink earrings.

Queen Letizia kept her make up and jewellery to a minimum, keeping the focus of her appearance on her outfit

Queen Letizia of Spain and Spanish acting Defense Minister, Margarita Robles (left), arrived at the International Friendship Awards ceremony in Madrid

The Spanish royal added a flattering black belt to her smart outfit, which cinched her in at the waist

Queen Letizia elongated her legs with a pair of impressive patent black stiletto heels, which perfectly matched her accessories

The mother-of-two looked in high spirits as she joined Margarita Robles at the 'International Friendship Award'
description: Queen Letizia of Spain, 47, cut a stylish figure as she arrived at IESE Business School in Madrid, Spain, today. The royal, who opted for a silk black blouse and grey checked skirt for the occasion.
